englishNarrator: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Apostle of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) saw sputum sticking to the Qibla of the mosque. He scratched it off with a pebble and then forbade spitting on the right side or in front, but (it is permissible) to spit on the left side or under the left foot.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira and Abu Sa'id رضی اللہ عنہما narrated:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) saw sputum, and a hadith similar to that of Ibn Uyaynah.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Apostle of Allah ( ﷺ) saw spittle or snot or sputum, sticking to the wall towards Qibla and scratched it off.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) saw some sputum in the direction of the Qibla of the mosque. He turned towards people and said: How Is it that someone amongst you stands before his Lord and then spits out in front of Him? Does any one of you like that he should be made to stand in front of someone and then spit at his face? So when any one of you spits, he must spit on his left side under his foot. But if he does not find (space to spit) he should do like this. Qasim (one of the narrators) spat in his cloth and then folded it and rubbed it.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: I perceive as if I am looking at the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) folding up a part of his cloth with another one.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: When any one of you is engaged in prayer, he is holding intimate conversation with his Lord, so none of you must spit in front of him, or towards his right side, but towards his left side under his foot.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: Spitting in a mosque is a sin, and its expiation is that it should be buried.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Shu'ba reported I asked Qatada about spitting, in the mosque. He said: I heard Anas bin Malik ‌رضی ‌اللہ ‌عنہ ‌say:
hadithEnglish: I heard the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) say: Spitting in the mosque is a sin, and its expiation is that it should be buried.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Apostle of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: The deeds of my people, good and bad, were presented before me, and I found the removal of something objectionable from the road among their good deeds, and the sputum mucus left unburied in the mosque among their evil deeds.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Abdullah bin Shakhkhir reported on the authority of his father that he said:
hadithEnglish: I said prayer with the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) and saw him spitting and rubbing it off with his shoe.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Abdullah bin Shakhkhir narrated it on the authority of his father:
hadithEnglish: He said prayer with the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌), and he spat and then rubbed it off with his left shoe.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Sa'd bin Yazid reported: I said to Anas bin Malik ‌رضی ‌اللہ ‌عنہ ‌:
hadithEnglish: Did the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) pray while putting on the shoes? He said: Yes.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Sa'd bin Yazid Abu Mas'ama reported:
hadithEnglish: I said to Anas ‌رضی ‌اللہ ‌عنہ like (that mentioned above).
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Apostle of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) prayed in a garment which had designs over it, so he (the Holy Prophet) said: Take it to Abu Jahm and bring me a plain blanket from him, because its designs have distracted me.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) stood for prayer with a garment which had designs over it. He looked at these designs and after completing the prayer said: Take this garment to Abu Jahm bin Hudhaifa and bring me a blanket for it has distracted me just now.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) had a garment which had designs upon it and this distracted him in prayer. He gave it to Abu Jahm and took a plain garment in its place which is known anbijaniya.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) saying: When the supper is brought and the prayer begins, one, should first take food
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: When the supper is brought before you, and it is also the time to say prayer, first take food before saying evening prayer and do not hasten (to prayer, leaving aside the food).
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: A hadith similar to that narrated by Ibn 'Uyaynah (no. 1241), from Az-Zuhri, from Anas ‌رضی ‌اللہ ‌عنہ was narrated from Aishah رضی اللہ عنہا , from the prophet ﷺ.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: When the supper is served to any one of you and the prayer also begins. (in such a case) first take supper, and do not make haste (for prayer) till you have (taken the food).
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: A hadith like this has been narrated from the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) on the authority of Ibn 'Umar ‌رضی ‌اللہ ‌عنہ with another chain of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

englishNarrator: Ibn Atiq reported: Al-Qasim was in the presence of 'A'isha (رضی اللہ عنہا) that I narrated a hadith and Qasim was a man who committed errors in (pronouncing words) and his mother was a freed slave-girl. 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا said to him:
hadithEnglish: What is the matter with you that you do not narrate as this son of my brother narrated (the ahaditb)? Well I know from where you picked it up. This is how his mother brought him up and how your mother brought you up. Qasim felt angry (on this remark of Hadrat 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا ) and showed bitterness towards her. When he saw that the table had been spread for 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا , he stood up, 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا, said: Where are you going? He said: (I am going) to say prayer. She said: Sit down (to take the food). He said: I must say prayer. She said: Sit down, ) faithless, for I have heard the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) say: No prayer can be (rightly said) when the food is there (before the worshipper), or when he is prompted by the call of nature.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: Abdullah bin 'Atiq narrated from the Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) on the authority of 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا , but he made no mention of the account of Qasim.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said during the battle of Khaybar: He who ate of this plant, i. e. garlic, should not come to the mosques. In the narration of Zubair, there is only a mention of battle and not of Khaybar.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer

hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: He who eats of this (offensive) plant must not approach our mosque, till its odor dies: (plant signifies) garlic.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Mosques and Places of Prayer
